<<<<<<< HEAD
The Italian prophecier. That is, A prognostication made for the yeere of our Lord God 1622. Practised by Antonio Magino, Professour of the Mathematickes, in the towne of Bononia, written fiue yeeres past: declaring many wonders and fearefull proceedings, wherewith the world is threatned to happen therein by warre this present yeere. With notable complaints made by diuers nations, touching the present estate of their countrey. Faithfully translated out of Italian into Dutch, and now into English Magini, Giovanni Antonio, 1555-1617.
[2], 21, [1] p.
Printed [by E. Allde?], [London?] : MDCXXII. [1622]
Printer's name from STC. Pages cropped at foot, with some loss of signatures. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

With notable complaints made by diuers nations, touching the present estate of their countrey. Faithfully translated out of Italian into Dutch, and now into English Magini, Giovanni Antonio, 1555-1617.
[2], 21, [1] p.
Printed [by E. Allde?], [London?] : MDCXXII. [1622]
